Description: The City's Access Center serves as the entry point and service hub of the City's continuum of care providing access to a wide-range of services to prevent homelessness.This program provides:- Homeless street outreach- Emergency shelter- Housing placement- Employment development- Benefits enrollment- Health care access- Mental health services- Substance abuse recovery- Veteran's services- Life skills training- Financial counseling- Legal services- Client stabilization resources- Computer resources- Transportation assistance- Basic needs emergency assistance- Homeless prevention resources
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Riverside County, CA.

Service_name: Operations Safe House Young Adult Emergency Services
Eligibility: ['This program helps people who are 11 to 17 years old.']
Description: Operation SafeHouse is a 24-hour emergency shelter whose mission is to serve runaway, homeless, and at-risk youth ages 11 - 17 in Riverside County. This program provides:- Three-weeks of emergency shelter- Nutritious meals- Counseling- Attempts at family reunification- On-site education program- Aftercare- 24- hour toll-free crisis line
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following cities: Riverside, CA.

Description: The Arlanza Community Center provides a cooling center for those who are disabled, elderly, or otherwise vulnerable to excessive heat.This program provides:- Relief from excessive heatThe cooling center generally activates when temperatures reach 100 degree F. The center generally closes during the day, but stays open continuously on days with excessive heat. Please call for more info.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following cities: Riverside, CA.

Description: The Community Shelter Program is a 30-60 day emergency homeless shelter that serves adult individuals experiencing housing crises by providing an immediate exit off of the street into temporary housing along with wraparound support services.This program provides:- Temporary shelterShelter guests are also provided with:- Assistance in obtaining important documents- Job readiness training- Housing referrals- Computer workshops- Counseling- Nutritious meals- Hygiene supplies- Showers- Social, spiritual, and emotional support- Case managementIntakes are conducted daily from 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. based on bed availability. Please call to schedule an appointment.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Riverside County, CA and San Bernardino County, CA.

Description: When the temperature climbs, Norton Younglove Community Center springs into action as a designated “Cool Center.” From June 1st to October 15th, we welcome vulnerable individuals, seniors, the disabled, and anyone seeking temporary relief from the scorching heat. Our air-conditioned facility provides a safe haven where you can beat the heat and stay comfortable. Remember, your well-being matters to us! Stay hydrated, take breaks, and enjoy the cool respite with us.🌞🏢🌟
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Riverside County, CA.
